intro: Erigeron utahensis var. tetrapleuris, commonly known as the Utah fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is usually hairy and grayish-green, adapted to conserve moisture in arid environments.
